s.text: Meanwhile one of the routine, strictly business clocks glimpsed through windows during the rounds of my unofficial beat could substitute for a watch.
When I tugged back a sleeve, the wrist was naked-- forgot my watch again--and both hands chapped and rough.

When I tugged back a sleeve, the wrist was naked-- forgot my watch again--and both hands chapped and rough.
When I tugged back a sleeve, the wrist was naked-- forgot my watch again--and both hands chapped and rough.
A white-haired man with olive skin and tattered clothes limped into Met Food and panhandled the clerk, one I recognized, her face mild and familiar as bread.
A white-haired man with olive skin and tattered clothes limped into Met Food and panhandled the clerk, one I recognized, her face mild and familiar as bread.
For half a second--strange--it felt permanent, indestructible as the tiny gleam that pearled in the dark pupil of her eye.
